pr_title: Fix query expression parsing and recovery issues

timeline.message:
Merge branch 'master' of https://github.com/ballerina-platform/ballerina-lang into Fix-query

 Conflicts:
	compiler/ballerina-parser/src/main/java/io/ballerinalang/compiler/internal/parser/BallerinaParser.java
Improve join-clause recovery for missing join-on-condition

timeline.bodyText:
Don't we need to recover here?
What if theres an additional token (say a public keyword) before the on keyword?
timeline.author: SupunS

replies.bodyText:
shouldn't that extra token be recovered as invalid in parseOnKeyword() beneath?
(note that at this point we don't have alternative paths.  path should go through on-keyword)
replies.author: lochana-chathura
SupunS

replies.bodyText:
var a = from var person in personList
outer join Department dept in deptList
 MISSING[+]// missing on clause
someExtraToken  MISSING[on] MISSING[] MISSING[equals] MISSING[]select {
    fname : person.fname,
    lname : person.lname,
    dept : dept.name
};

Above is the recovery if that extra token is an identifier.  if it is publicrecovery is pretty bad yet it is a valid syntax.
var a = from var person in personList
outer join Department dept in deptList
 MISSING[on] MISSING[<-]// missing on clause
 INVALID[public]  INVALID[select] {
    fname : person MISSING[,] INVALID[.]fname,
    lname : person MISSING[,] INVALID[.]lname,
    dept : dept MISSING[}].name
 MISSING[equals] MISSING[] MISSING[select] MISSING[] INVALID[}];

If we are going to handle when there's a  non-identifier token before the beginning of next clause in absence of join-on-condition it is like we are making join-on-condition optional in the error handler. As we don't allow that non-identifier to be part of join-on-condition. I think if there are extra tokens they should be allowed to be a part of join-on-condition recovery.
WDYT?
replies.author: lochana-chathura

replies.bodyText: We can do something like this in the error handler though. before parsing on-clause as next rule, we check if the next lookahead token is one of query starting tokens and if and only if, we skip join-on-condition path in the error handler. I feel that way recovery logic is consistence with parsing logic.
replies.author: lochana-chathura

replies.bodyText:
hmm, I feel which ever option we take, there will be consequences.
We can go ahead with the current approach, and can revisit if it becomes an actual issue.
replies.author: SupunS
